title: Changes as slab is inserted with open switch

content.description: A parallel-plate capacitor connected to a battery is fully charged with the switch S closed, as shown in the circuit above. A slab of dielectric constant K > 1 is slowly inserted between the plates of the capacitor.
content.question: If, instead, the switch is open with the capacitor still fully charged when the slab is inserted, what changes, if any, occur?

choices.label:
Potential Difference Across the Plates
 Charge on Positive Plate

Remains the same
 Increases

Potential Difference Across the Plates
 Charge on Positive Plate

Remains the same
 Decreases

Potential Difference Across the Plates
 Charge on Positive Plate

Increases
 Remains the same

Potential Difference Across the Plates
 Charge on Positive Plate

Decreases
 Increases

Potential Difference Across the Plates
 Charge on Positive Plate

Decreases
 Remains the same

content.answer:
Potential Difference Across the Plates
 Charge on Positive Plate

Decreases
 Remains the same

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
